content: i-love-stockinette baby bib by laura treadway version 2 2 i love stockinette stitch and when i say this i mean a bib made out of garter stitch just doesn t do it for me even though stockinette likes to curl i wanted a simple baby bib pattern to show of the beauty of stockinette this is what i came up with pattern can be knit in a solid color with contrasting cords variegated yarn stripes embellishments etc materials  60 yards of washable worsted weight yarn i used knit picks comfy worsted a cotton blend that is soft and comes in a nice palette dishcloth cotton like lily sugar n cream or pisgah peaches and creme or any of the many superwash wools available would also be a good  4 5 mm us 7 needles you ll need two double pointed needles dpns and a set of regular needles straight or circular gauge 5 stitches and 7 row = 1 inch skills used cast on knit purl increases decreases short row i cord applied i cord  make one right m1r refers to the following increase lift the bar between stitches with the left needle from the back and knit into the front left of that loop  make one left m1l refers to the following increase lift the bar between stitches with the left needle from the front and knit into the back left of that loop videos showing increases at http //www knittinghelp com/videos/increases  short row here is a good tutorial if you are not familiar with short row https //www purlsoho com/create/2008/06/18/short row/  applied i cord tutorials https //www jimmybeanswool com/secure html/onlineec/instructionalarticle asp iaid=108 or https //www purlsoho com/create/2008/01/23/attached i cord tutorial/ copyright © 2009 2017 all rights reserved ~ laura treadway www lauratreadway com ~ potentialofyarn blogspot com a pattern for non commercial use please feel free to share but keep the copyright notice intact 1 abbreviations used ws = wrong side p = purl pu = pick up rs = right side pm = place marker ssk = slip slip knit k = knit m = marker dpn = double pointed m1r = make one right p2tog = purl 2 together needles m1l = make one left w&t = wrap & turn instructions  cast on 26 stitches  knit bottom garter border row 1 ws knit 26 row 2 rs k3 m1r k20 mil k3 row 3 k28 row 4 k3 m1r k22 mil k2 row 5 k30  move into the stockinette portion row 6 k3 m1r knit until there are 3 st left mil k3 row 7 k3 purl until there are 3 st left k3 o repeat row 6 and 7 until there are 40 stitches on the needles row 14 and 15  move into the straightaway portion row 16 knit row 17 k3 purl until there are 3 st left k3 o repeat row 16 and 17 until piece measures 7 inches from cast on edge
